Detailed Description

Manpreet Kohli CS 340, Fall 2009

loadGame.cpp: creates the design for the saved game. Reads in the saved file, and based on the input, creates the blocks for the board. Also reads in the background (if any) that got saved when saving the level configuration

00031 
00032     // draw all the transparent blocks for the level editor window
00033     for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++)
00034     {
00035         for (int j = 0; j < 27; j++)
00036         {
00037             in >> c;
00038             if (c == 'w')
00039                 Constants::blocks[i][j] = new MonoBlock();
00040             else if (c == 'r')
00041                 Constants::blocks[i][j] = new RedBlock();
00042             else if (c == 'g')
00043                 Constants::blocks[i][j] = new GreenBlock();
00044             else if (c == 'b')
00045                 Constants::blocks[i][j] = new BlueBlock();
00046             else if (c == 'm')
00047                 Constants::blocks[i][j] = new MagentaBlock();
00048             else if (c == 'y')
00049                 Constants::blocks[i][j] = new YellowBlock();
00050             else
00051             {
00052                 xPos+=OUTLINEW;
00053                 continue;
00054             }
00055             theScene->addItem(Constants::blocks[i][j]);
00056             Constants::blocks[i][j]->setXPos(xPos);
00057             Constants::blocks[i][j]->setYPos(yPos);
00058             Constants::blocks[i][j]->setPos(xPos, yPos);
00059             Constants::blocks[i][j]->show();
00060             xPos+=OUTLINEW;
00061         }
00062         in >> c;
00063         in >> c;
00064         yPos += OUTLINEH;
00065         xPos = -375;
00066     }
00067 }
